intro: Uragoga tenella, commonly known as the slender urarara, is a flowering plant native to tropical regions of South America. It belongs to the family Malvaceae, which includes hibiscus and cotton plants. The plant is characterized by its delicate, hairy stems and small, pale yellow flowers. Its leaves are ovate and often have a velvety texture. Uragoga tenella is typically found in moist, shaded environments such as forest understories.
